intro: Lophopterys occidentalis, commonly known as the western lophopterys, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, ovate leaves that have a distinctive reddish hue. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones and forest understories.
